Title: Good in the dark
Cons:
Bright light photos
Memory card is a dinosaur
Pros:
Low light photos, unbeatable
Size, like the Canons
Battery life is endless
Comments: Need a 28mm and better bright light exposure.

Title: Finally - a camera that takes decent low light pictures
Cons:
non-standard battery
flimsy micro-usb cover
Pros: Might not be the best camera on the market but if you are looking for a camera that takes excellent pictures in all lighting conditions including the dreadful lowlight = 'low quality' conditions, look no further!
Comments: Cons are really a non issue.  This camera is great.

Title: Rob is confused
Cons: xD card format, but no big deal.
Pros: I think the guy from the previous review is really confused. Most people buy F30 for it's low light perfomance... This is the only P/S camera that rivals many DSLR's with it's 3200ISO. This camera is a gem for lowlight photography, iso range is very usable up until ISO1600, at 800 u see a slight loss of detail, in fact noise isn't visible until iso 1600.
Comments: Rob is totally clueless about digital photography...  This camera wipes the floor with Canon SD series... Buy it, but only if you know what u're doing and if u can take the advantage oo camera's manual controls. Go to dpreview.com for a detailed review of F30 by a professional phtographer. So far this is the best compact digicam on the market.

Title: 2 Months. No rebate yet.
Cons:
Not for dark, or low light shots. Lots of noise with low light shots.
Almost 2 months now, and rebate not here yet. What a shame Fuji! Loses one star because of that. Will only get 2 if 2 more months pass without it.
Pros: Nice, cool camera. Great pictures, if you have plenty of light.
Comments: Only buy Fuji if you're fine with the price without rebate. By the way, rebates should be outlawed altogether; Disgusting, how they can scam you with them.

Title: FUJIFILM FinePix F30 Silver 6.3MP Digital Camera
Cons: The cover over the USB and charger plug-in is very clumsy & flimsy to work with. It probably will eventually break off and be lost.
Pros:
Great camera. This is my 4th digital and a backup for my Fuji S7000. I needed a small camera to carry in my vest pocket when in the field collecting rocks, minerals, gems, and relics. 

I was amazed at the performance and the quality of the photos. I did not think I could get this from such a small package. Also, I did a lot of videos while in the field this weekend. The sound and picture quality was great. 

I recommend this product.

Title: Great Mid-Level Camera
Cons: Only 3X optical zoom, but thats all you get from cameras this size.
Pros: Great Low Light capture, very fast - seconds to grab camera, turn on, aim and shoot beautiful pictures.  Plenty of menu features allowing very nice viewing options.  Great Battery Life - took days of use before needing a re-charge.
Comments: We also use the camera to shoot videos, and with a 1mb xD card, it shoots almost 16 minutes of highest resolution video footage...very nice added feature.

Title: Excellent camera!
Cons:
1. xD card - slower, more expensive and proprietary
2. takes somewhat ok pictures when lots of light in automatic mode (but play with the manual settings and/or the scenes and you'll get them bright and crisp)
3. it doesn't have "anti-shake" or real stabilization - however, because you'll need it mostly in low light, with a range of iso of 3200, you don't need to think about it too much; plus, there is a setting that acts as a stabilization mode
4. ergonomically: it's not as thin, although not bad, and the usb cover is a bit difficult to open but come on, these are details that should be overlooked in light of all the pros
Pros:
Bought the camera about a month ago and have already used it on longer shoots.  I did a lot of research before buying it: it was between a canon sd600 or this fuji.  I chose this mainly because it was cheaper than the canon and because the reviews were glowing.  And they were true!  The camera is fantastic in almost every regard.  
1. It takes excellent pictures in low and very low light conditions.  The ISO goes up to 3200!  
2. You can set aperture, ISO etc manually if you want to, but I found that the automatic mode takes great pictures in most conditions (see below).  
3. You can make movies with audio, and the quality is not bad.  
4. The battery is great!  We've used the camera for about 2 weeks and it is still showing a full charge.
Comments: It's a great camera.  I didn't want to buy another camera with an xD card (had a fuji before that was great and an olympus that took horrible pictures inside) but I can't praise this camera enough!  (I've recently seen other people taking pictures and how awful their shots looked on their ccd compared to our little camera) - so you won't regret buying it.

Title: Better than anticipated
Cons: A compact this good means the Nikon D70 won't be coming out of it's spot on the shelf nearly as often!
Pros: After reading glowing reviews of the F30 at sites like dpreview and dcresource I was prepared to be impressed by the camera, but after a fair amount of use and testing the camera exceeded my expectations.  The low light performance and battery life are great, as advertised, but its ease of use and responsiveness make it something the whole family can pick up without spending a second looking at the manual, and they can produce great photographs and movies.

Title: Awsome
Cons: Doesn't come with a case...as of yet, that is all
Pros: Great low-light pictures, The natural light mode is amazing, just amazing.  Picture quality is really high, no problems seen as of yet with anything involved with this camera, a 512MB card can take over 300 pics, real easy to not need anymore unless you are on a long trip with no access to a computer
Comments: BUY THIS CAMERA, GREAT BANG FOR THE BUCK!!!!!

Title: Great small Camera
Cons: Could have had more internal memory ,10mb don't go far
Pros: It has great range ,from takeing pictures in candle light, to in sunlight ,Has high ISO to 3200 ,even taking pictures at ISO 1600 look great and at ISO 3200 the noise is not as bad as you would think,with 4"x 6" picture.Has manual controls and build in stablizer to help with camera shake It has shutter ,ampreture and white ballance so you can set manual ,Has detailed 2.5" inch LCD viewer, with 230,000 resulotion Has a very long battery life ,up to 580 pictures,It is build very good and has a lot more features that I have'nt mention.
Comments: If you are looking for a camera that is almost the same quailty as a SLR then look no farther,ever review I have looked at puts this camera number 1 excepically in low light conditions,If you are just a point and shoot person or a person that likes to set controls manually then you will love this camera.there are cheaper cameras out there ,but you will not get the same quailty ,I have not seen many camers that can take a decent picture at ISO 1600.
